author: Valkyrious
title: Marine Ranks
text: Z (resigned; non-canon) [99] References ↑ 2.0 2.1 SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 24 (p. 26), The Marine uniform explained. ↑ 3.0 3.1 SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 29 (p. 26), The difference between those present at the Marine Headquarters. ↑ 4.0 4.1 4.2 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 66 Chapter 650 (p. 6) and Episode 570 , Sakazuki is revealed to have been promoted to Fleet Admiral. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 0 Chapter 0 (p. 3) and Episode 0 , Kong is shown as a Fleet Admiral during the Edd War. ↑ 6.0 6.1 6.2 6.3 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 60 Chapter 594 (p. 4) and Episode 511 , Commander-in-Chief Kong speaks about Sengoku and Garp's position transfers. ↑ 7.0 7.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 25 Chapter 233 (p. 4) and Episode 151 , Fleet Admiral Sengoku is introduced. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 34 Chapter 319 (p. 4) and Episode 227 , Robin states that the admirals are the World Government's "Greatest Fighting Force". ↑ 9.0 9.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 52 Chapter 507 (p. 15) and Episode 401 , Borsalino is introduced as Admiral Kizaru. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 71 Chapter 705 (p. 7) and Episode 634 , Issho is revealed to be Admiral Fujitora. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 72 Chapter 713 (p. 3) and Episode 643 , Admiral Ryokugyu is mentioned by Doflamingo. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 41 Chapter 395 (p. 10) and Episode 277 , Sengoku is referred to as an Admiral 22 years ago by Spandine. ↑ 13.0 13.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 56 Chapter 550 (p. 11) and Episode 459 , Sakazuki is revealed to be Admiral Akainu. ↑ 14.0 14.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 34 Chapter 318 (p. 19) and Episode 226 , Kuzan is revealed to be Admiral Aokiji. ↑ One Piece Movie 12 , Zephyr is shown as a Marine Admiral who was transferred to an instructor position. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 60 Chapter 594 (p. 7) and Episode 511 , Dr. Fishbonen states Haki is a power all vice admirals use. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 72 Chapter 719 (p. 8-9) and Episode 649 , Garp uses Busoshoku Haki to harden his fist in his fight with Chinjao. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 68 Chapter 672 (p. 4) and Episode 598 , Vergo hardens a bamboo stick. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 69 Chapter 684 (p. 6) and Episode 610 , Smoker uses Haki to harden his fists to strike Vergo. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 25 Chapter 234 (p. 2) and Episode 151 , Tsuru is introduced as a Vice Admiral. ↑ One Piece Blue: Grand Data File (p. 55), John is revealed to be a Vice Admiral. ↑ One Piece Manga — Vol. 31 Chapter 290 , cover story: Ace's Great Blackbeard Search Vol. 16, Comil is seen in the attire of a Vice Admiral. ↑ 23.0 23.1 23.2 23.3 23.4 23.5 One Piece Yellow: Grand Elements (p. 153), The Vice Admirals who led the Buster Call on Enies Lobby have their names revealed. ↑ 24.0 24.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 56 Chapter 550 (p. 13) and Episode 459 , Lacroix and Ronse are introduced wearing the attire of Vice Admirals. ↑ 25.0 25.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 11 Chapter 96 (p. 5) and Episode 45 , Stainless and Cancer are introduced wearing the attire of Vice Admirals. ↑ One Piece Blue Deep: Characters World (p. 212), Mozambia is revealed to be a Vice Admiral. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 57 Chapter 553 (p. 11) and Episode 462 , Dalmatian is identified as a Vice Admiral. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 57 Chapter 553 (p. 10) and Episode 462 , Bastille is identified as a Vice Admiral. ↑ 29.0 29.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 66 Chapter 655 (p. 8) and Episode 579 , Smoker is revealed to have become a Vice Admiral over the timeskip. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 71 Chapter 705 (p. 5) and Episode 634 , Maynard is identified as a Vice Admiral. ↑ SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 74 , Momousagi is identified as a Vice Admiral. ↑ SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 75 , Chaton is identified as a Vice Admiral. ↑ Jonathan's rank is mentioned on Toei's webpage . ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 41 Chapter 396 (p. 12) and Episode 277 , Saul is identified as a Vice Admiral who deserted the Marines. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 41 Chapter 393 (p. 19) and Episode 276 , Kuzan is revealed to have been a Vice Admiral during the Buster Call led on Ohara. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 41 Chapter 397 (p. 12) and Episode 278 , Sakazuki is revealed to have been a Vice Admiral during the Buster Call led on Ohara. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 63 Chapter 622 (p. 10) and Episode 541 , Borsalino is revealed to have been a Vice Admiral 15 years ago. ↑ 38.0 38.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 68 Chapter 673 (p. 15) and Episode 599 , Vergo is identified as a Vice Admiral. ↑ One Piece Blue Deep: Characters World (p. 216), Catacombo is revealed to be a Rear Admiral. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 63 Chapter 622 (p. 8) and Episode 541 , Kadar is addressed as a Rear Admiral. ↑ 42.0 42.1 One Piece Manga — Vol. 82 Chapter 823 (p. 2), Hina is revealed to be a Rear Admiral. ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 464 , Yukimura is revealed to be a Rear Admiral. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 63 Chapter 623 (p. 10) and Episode 543 , Strawberry is revealed to have been a Rear Admiral 15 years ago. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 52 Chapter 509 (p. 9) and Episode 402 , Kizaru calls Drake a "former rear admiral". ↑ 46.0 46.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 70 Chapter 700 (p. 12) and Episode 629 , Brannew is revealed to have been promoted to Commodore. ↑ One Piece Blue Deep: Characters World (p. 215), Daigin is revealed to be a Commodore. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 68 Chapter 673 (p. 3) and Episode 599 , Yarisugi is identified as a Commodore. ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 475 , Kibin is identified as a Commodore. ↑ Bilić is identified as a Commodore in Episode of Luffy . ↑ 51.0 51.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 45 Chapter 439 (p. 16) and Episode 324 , Smoker is referred to as a Commodore. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 9 Chapter 75 (p. 9) and Episode 34 , Pudding Pudding is referred to as a Commodore. ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 575 , Shuzo is revealed to have formerly been a Commodore. ↑ 54.0 54.1 SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 68 , Coby is revealed to have been promoted to Captain. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 38 Chapter 365 (p. 8) and Episode 255 , T-Bone is addressed as a Captain. ↑ 56.0 56.1 56.2 SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 47 , The captains who assisted in the Buster Call on Enies Lobby are identified. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 61 Chapter 596 (p. 12) and Episode 514 , Gorilla is addressed as a Captain. ↑ 58.0 58.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 66 Chapter 652 (p. 18) and Episode 572 , Tashigi is revealed to have been promoted to Captain. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 8 Chapter 69 (p. 12) and Episode 31 , Nezumi is identified as a Captain. ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 136 , Moore is addressed as a Captain. ↑ Trap is referred to as a Captain in ONE PIECE 3D! Trap Coaster . ↑ 62.0 62.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 1 Chapter 4 (p. 9) and Episode 2 , Morgan is identified as a Captain. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 11 Chapter 98 (p. 15) and Episode 52 , Smoker is identified as a Captain. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 73 Chapter 728 (p. 2) and Episode 660 , Vergo is referred to as a Captain. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 23 Chapter 212 (p. 3) and Episode 127 , Hina is introduced as a Captain. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 1 Chapter 7 (p. 8-9) and Episode 3 , Ripper succeeds Morgan as head of the base in Shells Town. ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 309 , Glove is referred to as a Commander. ↑ Governor is addressed as a Commander in Episode Special 3 . ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 199 , Shepherd is addressed as a Commander. ↑ One Piece Manga — Vol. 77 Chapter 764 (p. 14), Rosinante is classified as a Commander. ↑ 71.0 71.1 SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 68 , Helmeppo is revealed to have been promoted to Lieutenant Commander. ↑ Hardy is revealed to be a Lieutenant Commander on page 28 of the One Piece Novel "The Legend of Thousand Year Dragon". ↑ 73.0 73.1 One Piece Anime — Episode 139 , Rapanui is addressed as a Lieutenant Commander. ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 196 , Drake is addressed as a Lieutenant Commander. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 11 Chapter 96 (p. 6) and Episode 45 , Brannew is classified as a Lieutenant Commander. ↑ 76.0 76.1 SBS One Piece Manga — Vol. 6 , Morgan is revealed to have been a Chief Petty Officer and then a Lieutenant Commander prior to becoming a Captain. ↑ Randolph is revealed to be a former Lieutenant Commander in Episode Special 3 . ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 5 Chapter 43 (p. 5) and Episode 20 , Fullbody is classified as a Lieutenant. ↑ One Piece Manga — Vol. 19 Chapter 168 , cover story: Jango's Dance Paradise Vol. 33, Fullbody is demoted in order to free Jango. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 54 Chapter 524 (p. 15) and Episode 421 , Stalker is addressed as a Lieutenant Junior Grade. ↑ One Piece Blue: Grand Data File , Makko is classified as an Ensign. ↑ 83.0 83.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 45 Chapter 439 (p. 16) and Episode 324 , Tashigi is addressed as Ensign. ↑ One Piece Anime — Episode 50 , Masterson is revealed to have been a former Ensign. ↑ One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 11 Chapter 98 (p. 17) and Episode 52 , Tashigi is classified as a Master Chief Petty Officer. ↑ 86.0 86.1 One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 45 Chapter 432 (p. 13) and Episode 314 , Coby is classified as a Master Chief Petty Officer.
